æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Python Exploit for TP-Link TL-WR940N/TL-WR841N Command Injection Vulnerability

Usage Instructions

  1. Basic Vulnerability Check:

  2. Execute Custom Command:

  3. Reverse Shell (set up listener first with nc -lvnp 4444):

Important Notes:

  • These scripts are for educational and testing purposes only
  • Always get proper authorization before testing any system
  • The reboot command is used as default because itâ€™s non-destructive and easily verifiable
  • The reverse shell may not work on all firmware versions as it depends on available binaries
  • Some firmware versions require a random path in the URL which the script attempts to detect automatically

The vulnerability exists due to improper input sanitization in the ssid1 parameter of the /userRpm/WlanNetworkRpm.htm endpoint, allowing command injection through specially crafted requests.

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Langflowçš„/api/v1/validate/codeç«¯ç‚¹ä¸å®‰å…¨åœ°æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æˆ·æä¾›çš„ä»£ç ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Pythonçš„exec()å‡½æ•°ï¼Œæ— éœ€è®¤è¯æˆ–æ²™ç®±ä¿æŠ¤ã€‚è¿™ä½¿å¾—è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…èƒ½å¤Ÿæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„çš„Pythonä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Langflow

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Langflow

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š < 1.3.0

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/issamjr/CVE-2025-3248-Scanner

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • requirements.txt
  • scanner.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-3248 Langflow RCE Scanner

ğŸ” Description

A powerful, unauthenticated RCE scanner for CVE-2025-3248 in vulnerable Langflow instances.

  • CVE: 2025-3248
  • Type: Remote Code Execution (Unauthenticated)
  • Affected: Langflow < 1.3.0
  • Author: Issam Junior (@issamiso)

ğŸ’¥ Vulnerability Overview

Langflowâ€™s /api/v1/validate/code endpoint insecurely executes user-supplied code using Python exec(), without authentication or sandboxing. This enables remote attackers to execute arbitrary Python code.

âœ… Protection

  • Upgrade to Langflow 1.3.0 or newer
  • Block access to /api/v1/validate/code
  • Use proper code sandboxing (e.g., Pyodide, Docker, restricted ASTs)

âš™ï¸ Usage

ğŸ” Disclaimer

This tool is for authorized security research only. Misuse is prohibited.

ğŸ› ï¸ Contact

Developer: Issam Junior
Telegram: @issamiso
GitHub: github.com/issamjr

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ååºåˆ—åŒ–

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Roundcube Webmailä¸­çš„upload.phpæ–‡ä»¶æœªéªŒè¯â€™_fromâ€™å‚æ•°ï¼Œå…è®¸æ³¨å…¥æ¶æ„çš„åºåˆ—åŒ–PHPå¯¹è±¡ã€‚è¿™ä½¿å¾—è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…ï¼ˆå…·æœ‰æœ‰æ•ˆä¼šè¯ï¼‰å¯ä»¥åœ¨é‚®ä»¶æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šå®ç°å®Œæ•´çš„è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆRCEï¼‰ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Roundcube

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Roundcube Webmail

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š Roundcube < 1.5.10 and < 1.6.11

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/issamjr/CVE-2025-49113-Scanner

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • requirements.txt
  • scanner.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-49113 Scanner

ğŸ” Description

A powerful, multi-method Python scanner for detecting CVE-2025-49113, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail.

  • CVE: 2025-49113
  • Type: Authenticated Remote Code Execution via unsafe PHP object deserialization
  • Affected Versions: Roundcube < 1.5.10 and < 1.6.11
  • Author: Issam Junior (@issamiso)

ğŸ’¥ Vulnerability Summary

upload.php in Roundcube Webmail does not validate the '_from' parameter, allowing injection of malicious serialized PHP objects. This enables a remote attacker (with valid session) to achieve full remote code execution (RCE) on the mail server.

ğŸ§ª Detection Methods

This scanner uses three different techniques to detect the vulnerability:

  1. Error-Based Analysis â€“ Detects typical PHP fatal errors in the response.
  2. Serialization Leakage â€“ Identifies object serialization responses.
  3. Header Anomaly Checks â€“ Detects headers suggesting exploitable configurations (like exposed X-Powered-By: PHP).

The script also automatically detects Roundcube installations before testing.

âœ… Protection & Mitigation

  • Upgrade to Roundcube 1.5.10 or 1.6.11
  • Filter and sanitize user input
  • Disable unserialize usage or apply secure serialization handlers
  • Enforce secure cookie attributes (HttpOnly, SameSite, etc.)

âš™ï¸ Usage

Clone and install requirements:

Scan a single target:

Scan a list of targets:

Targets must be authenticated or simulate session using cookies (default uses roundcube_sessid=fake-session).

ğŸ“ Example File (targets.txt)

ğŸ” Disclaimer

This tool is intended only for authorized security auditing and educational purposes.
The author is not responsible for any damage caused by misuse.

ğŸ› ï¸ Contact

Developer: Issam Junior
Telegram: @issamiso
GitHub: github.com/issamjr

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å«

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2025-26909æ˜¯WordPressæ’ä»¶â€™Hide My WP Ghostâ€™ä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡çš„æœ¬åœ°æ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å«ï¼ˆLFIï¼‰æ¼æ´ï¼Œå½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬<=5.4.01ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡æ»¥ç”¨æœªæ­£ç¡®éªŒè¯çš„æ–‡ä»¶è·¯å¾„è¾“å…¥æ¥è¯»å–æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šçš„ä»»æ„æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´æ•æ„Ÿä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ²æˆ–è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Hide My WP Ghost

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Hide My WP Ghost

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 5.4.01

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/issamjr/CVE-2025-26909-Scanner

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • requirements.txt
  • scanner.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-26909 Vulnerability Scanner

A Python-based scanner and proof-of-concept script for detecting CVE-2025-26909 in WordPress plugin â€œHide My WP Ghostâ€ by Issam Junior.

ğŸ” Vulnerability Overview

CVE-2025-26909 is a critical Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability found in versions <= 5.4.01 of the â€œHide My WP Ghostâ€ plugin. This flaw allows attackers to read arbitrary files on the server by abusing improperly validated file path inputs.

ğŸ’¥ Impact

Attackers may exploit this flaw to:

  • View sensitive files such as /etc/passwd, wp-config.php.
  • Execute remote PHP code using LFI chains if combined with other misconfigurations.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Mitigation

  • Update the plugin to version 5.4.02 or newer.
  • Disable the â€œChange Pathsâ€ feature if it is not needed.
  • Apply file inclusion filtering and file access hardening (AppArmor, chroot, etc).

ğŸš€ Usage

1. Clone the tool

2. Install dependencies

3. Run the scanner

ğŸ“ Output Format

  • [+] Vulnerable
  • [-] Not Vulnerable
  • [*] Checking
  • [!] Errors

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Author

  • Issam Junior
  • Telegram: @issamiso
  • GitHub: issamjr

entry.title: Apache Dubbo ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Apache Dubbo ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2019-17564

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ååºåˆ—åŒ–

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Apache Dubbo 2.7.0è‡³2.7.4ç‰ˆæœ¬ã€2.6.0è‡³2.6.7ç‰ˆæœ¬ä»¥åŠæ‰€æœ‰2.5.xç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´ï¼Œç”±äºåœ¨HTTP POSTè¯·æ±‚ä¸­æ¥å—ä¸å—ä¿¡ä»»çš„Javaå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡å‘é€æ¶æ„çš„Javaå¯¹è±¡å®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶Providerå®ä¾‹ï¼Œå‰ææ˜¯HTTPè¢«å¯ç”¨ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Dubbo

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2.5.x, 2.6.0 <= version <= 2.6.7, 2.7.0 <= version <= 2.7.4

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12444

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Apache Dubbo versions 2.7.0 to 2.7.4, 2.6.0 to 2.6.7, and all 2.5.x versions contain an insecure deserialization caused by accepting untrusted Java objects in HTTP POST requests, letting attackers fully compromise a Provider instance if HTTP is enabled, exploit requires attacker to send malicious Java object.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://github.com/fairyming/CVE-2019-17564
  • https://github.com/Dor-Tumarkin/CVE-2019-17564-FastJson-Gadget
  • https://github.com/Exploit-3389/CVE-2019-17564
  • https://github.com/Hu3sky/CVE-2019-17564
  • https://github.com/Jaky5155/CVE-2019-17564
  • https://github.com/r00t4dm/CVE-2019-17564

KEV: True

Shodan Query: NA

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

Anyscale Ray 2.6.3 and 2.8.0 contain a remote code execution caused by insecure job submission API, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires network access to the API.

Shodan Query: NA

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. entry.title: Apache HTTP Server mod_proxy_uwsgi ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ²ä¸è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Apache HTTP Server mod_proxy_uwsgi ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ²ä¸è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2020-11984

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ²

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Apache HTTP Server 2.4.32è‡³2.4.44ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­çš„mod_proxy_uwsgiæ¨¡å—å­˜åœ¨ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ²åŠå¯èƒ½çš„è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶è¯·æ±‚è®¿é—®æ•æ„Ÿä¿¡æ¯å¹¶å¯èƒ½æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š HTTP Server

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2.4.32 <= version <= 2.4.44

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š cpe:â€cpe:2.3:a:apache:http_serverâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12266

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Apache HTTP Server 2.4.32 to 2.4.44 contains an info disclosure and possible remote code execution caused by a vulnerability in mod_proxy_uwsgi, letting remote attackers access sensitive information and potentially execute arbitrary code, exploit requires sending crafted requests.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159009/Apache2-mod_proxy_uwsgi-Incorrect-Request-Handling.html

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:a:apache:http_server"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
